p: Fresh ginger possesses antiviral activity against the human respiratory syncytial virus (HRSV) in both upper and lower respiratory tract cell lines ( Chang et al., 2013). It inhibits viral attachment and internalisation, causing about 70% decrease in infection. (6)-, (8)-, and (10)-gingerols are the major constituents of fresh ginger that inhibit HRSV, acting by interacting with G and F proteins that the virus utilizes to attach to and penetrate host cells ( Chang et al., 2013). Therefore, ginger is more effective when administered before viral inoculation.
